column1: CMOR Table day: Daily Mean Atmosphere, Ocean and Surface Fields
(saved on the model's atmospheric or ocean grid, as appropriate)
In CMOR Table day: 2-D daily mean atmospheric and surface fields
The following daily mean variables should be collected for all simulations (for each ensemble member and the full duration of each experiment).

column4: comment
near-surface (usually, 2 meter) specific humidity.
daily-minimum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature.
daily-maximum near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature.
daily-mean near-surface (usually, 2 meter) air temperature.
at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases from all types of clouds (both large-scale and convective)
near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.
square of temperature of liquid ocean, averaged over the day. Report on the ocean grid.  This variable appears in WGOMD Table 2.2
temperature of liquid ocean. Report on the ocean grid.  This variable appears in WGOMD Table 2.2

column2: Daily Maximum Ocean Mixed Layer Thickness De_ned by Mixing Scheme
column4: This variable appears in WGOMD Table 2.2

column1: The rest of the daily mean fields on this spreadsheet should be collected only for a single ensemble member of the following experiments.

column4: experiment
pre-industrial controls
column5: 20 years, preferably corresponding to years 1986-2005 of the historical run

column4: historical
future simulations driven by RCP concentrations or emissions

column1: CMOR Table day: 2-D daily-mean atmospheric and surface fields

column4: comment

column2: Moisture in Upper 0.1 m of Soil Column
column4: Compute the mass of water in all phases in the upper 0.1 meters of soil.
near-surface (usually, 2 meter) relative humidity.  This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
near-surface (usually, 2 meter) minimum  relative humidity.  This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
near-surface (usually, 2 meter) maximum  relative humidity.  This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
for the whole atmospheric column, as seen from the surface or the top of the atmosphere. Include both large-scale and convective cloud.

column2: Surface Temperature Where Land or Sea Ice
column4: "skin" temperature of all surfaces except open ocean.

Compute as the mass of surface snow on the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell; report 0.0 where the land fraction is 0; exclude snow on vegetation canopy or on sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: at surface; includes both liquid and solid phases.
at surface; includes precipitation of all forms of water in the solid phase
compute as the total runoff (including "drainage" through the base of the soil model) leaving the land portion of the grid cell divided by the land area in the grid cell.
column10: time: mean area: mean where land

column4: near-surface (usually, 10 meters) eastward component of wind.
near-surface (usually, 10 meters) northward component of wind.
near-surface (usually, 10 meters) wind speed.
at the top of the atmosphere.
Report on ocean's grid.  Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
Report on ocean's grid.  Report as "missing" in regions free of sea ice.
fraction of grid cell covered by sea ice. Report on ocean's grid.

Report on ocean's grid.  Compute the mean thickness of sea ice in the ocean portion of the grid cell (averaging over the entire ocean portion, including the ice-free fraction).  Report as 0.0 in regions free of sea ice.
column10: time: mean area: mean where sea

column1: In CMOR Table day: daily mean 3-D atmospheric fields on the following pressure surfaces: 1000, 850, 700, 500, 250, 100, 50, and 10 hPa

column4: comment
This is the relative humidity with respect to liquid water for T> 0 C, and with respect to ice for T<0 C.
commonly referred to as "omega", this represents the vertical component of velocity in pressure coordinates (positive down)
